alert.note: Alert for Allen; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 11:49AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wilson, northwestern Labette, Neosho, northeastern Montgomery, Woodson and southwestern Allen Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1147 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending from northeast Greenwood county across Woodson and Wilson counties, this activity will move southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parsons, Chanute, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Humboldt, Yates Center, Erie, Thayer, Altoona, Toronto, Buffalo, Galesburg, Benedict, Earlton, Coyville, Lake Parsons, Parsons Tri City Airport, Dennis and Rose. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 400 PM CDT for southeastern Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson
